title: Will there be a series 2 of BBC One drama The Capture?
text:
The Capture has had no shortage of suspense (Picture: BBC)

The Capture is set to come to an end on BBC One after keeping Tuesday night viewers gripped in recent weeks.

The series, which follows the case of Shaun Emery (Callum Turner) soldier returned from Afghanistan who is charged with a crime, and Rachel Carey (Holliday Grainger) the DI who is called in to investigate – delivered a twist-laden penultimate instalment last week which left everybody guessing as to how things would be wrapped up.

Expect more drama as it all wraps up tonight – but what time should you tune in?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is the series finale of The Capture?

The Capture’s final episode will air on BBC One on Tuesday night at 9pm.

The hour-long episode will bring things to an end between Holby City and the 10 O’Clock News.

How will it all end for Shaun? (Picture: BBC)

What happens in tonight’s episode of The Capture?

We’re not sure we’re quite recovered from last week’s instalment but here’s what you can expect from the finale

The synopsis tells us that the mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London, while Rachel faces a choice which will not only determine Shaun’s fate but could also have ramifications for the entire criminal justice system.

We. Cannot. Wait…

Who is in the cast of The Capture?

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The show has featured a pretty impressive cast led by Turner – who recently starred in War and Peace and Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes Of Grindelwald – as Shaun.

You might also recognise Grainger from JK Rowling series Strike – while other cast members include Ron Perlman and Downton’s Laura Haddock as Shaun’s barrister Hannah Roberts – around whom his crime revolves.

You might also recognise The Crown’s Ben Miles and Lia Williams – as well as Famke Janssen arriving tonight in the role of Jessica Mallory.
